Author: Seko#7408
Content: Can someone explain me where the essential difference are between Monero, Zcash and PIRATE?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: XMR requires all tx to be private. ZEC doesnt, but has better privacy tech.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: PIRATE is the best of both, required zero knowledge tx

Author: Seko#7408
Content: Zksnarks is better than ct-Ring? Which essential difference?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a 10way ring sig means your tx always has your signature in it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so you get plausible deniability, but still need to deny it was you

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with zksnark, there is no info about who sent, who received, and how much, it is zero footprint

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: with XMR and such others could break your privacy. with zero knowledge, you'll have to help them

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: a lot

Author: Seko#7408
Content: This means 10 rings check the transaction.  With all 10 you could draw conclusions?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: well yes that and the big issue is that for a tx that you do, you are one of the 10

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so imagine a trail of all these transactions, each has your signature in it along with 9 others

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with PIRATE,  you cant tell who is sending, who is receiving or for how much. nothing to deny

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: On the bright side if it all goes bad and you go to jail, you'll have 9 cellmates with similar interests

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content:
"\nReturns the estimated network solutions per second based on the last n blocks.\n"
yes Msol is just average over last 120 blocks
diff adjustments over 17 block window, so that is why diff is more volatile
which means the diff will appear to lead the Msols
like SMA 17 vs SMA.120
but not exactly as diff has caps per adjustment and isnt a pure MA
thanks! I never knew this until now
👏

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: I was thinking about PIRATE coin today and privacy coins in general. And even if you build the best privacy coin, the price volatility problem remains. You might have small groups of people trading it, maybe some even using it as a currency, but it would probably never have large adoption. If it had the features of a stable coin, pegged to FIAT money or gold, but with strong privacy features, that might be used more widely. But not easy to do I imagine.
